posts.title: A Balinese Trance Seance
posts.excerpt: A Balinese Trance SeanceBringing offerings of rice, flowers, and woven coconut leaves, clients visit Jero in her household shrine to determine the cause of their son’s death. posts._title: Ryosuke Hashiguchi – Koibitotachi AKA Three Stories of Love (2015)
posts.title: Koibitotachi
posts.excerpt: Quote:Atsushi is a civic construction worker who was widowed following a random murder. Toko’s husband is neither interested in her nor in how his mother treats his wife. Shinomiya is a lawyer whose homosexuality has lead to mismatched love. The three separate stories tread a thread of hope, love, rejection and abandonment. Three relative cinema …

posts.title: Pandaemonium
posts.excerpt: The troubled friendship and occasional rivalry between two of England’s greatest poets, Samuel Taylor Coleridge and William Wordsworth, is explored in an unorthodox light in this historical drama from renegade director Julian Temple. posts.title: Turumba
posts.excerpt: J. Hoberman, The Village Voice: Set in a tiny Philippine village, the inimitable Kidlat Tahimik’s film focuses on a family that makes papier-mache animals to sell during the traditional Turumba festivities. posts.title: El viaje
posts.excerpt: A young man living in a cold southern village in South America, decides to start a trip looking for his father. By doing this he discovers unexpected facts about his latin American essence.
